ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: Ministry of Defence, Land Equipment, Dismounted Close Combat (DCC)

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: Ministry of Defence, Land Equipment, Dismounted Close Combat (DCC)
ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.ADDRESS: Ministry of Defence, Land Equipment, Surveillance and Target Acquisition Team, MOD Abbey Wood, Elm 3c, #4325

TITLE.P: Provision for LF28 Ad Hoc Repairs and Procurement

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Authority requires the provision of ad hoc repairs and procurement of parts to provide continuing support to the in-service fleet of LF28 Laser Designators in a 3 year contract.
Combined Support, Repair and Procurement services for LF28 Laser Designator.

INFO_ADD.P: This is an ad hoc service so will be powered by demand on the systems.

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: It is considered that this Contract can be placed directly with Thales using the negotiated procedure without prior publication for technical and safety reasons in accordance with Article 28(1)(e) of Directive 2009/81/EC (Regulation 16(1)(a)(ii) of the UK Defence and Security Public Contracts Regulations 2011). Thales UK is the only economic operator with the required expertise to carry out the repair services to fulfil the MOD operational requirements. Thales is the Design Authority and current supplier of these laser systems. No other supplier has access to the technical data, proprietary information and facilities, knowledge and experience required to provide the support required as Design Authority, and underwrite the integrity of any modifications or changes to the systems.

It would take another economic operator a disproportionate amount of time to become sufficiently qualified to undertake the requirement and to be able to provide the requisite assurances that alternative repair facilities could be safely and reliably used with the existing systems and ancillaries. The qualification program required to provide such assurances is a lengthy and complicated process and would mean that identifying another economic operator would invite substantial risks to both the safe functioning of the Armed Forces and the interoperability of parts within the laser systems. It would therefore be technically impractical for another economic operator to fulfil this requirement without introducing a disproportionate safety risk to the LF28 platform. This would also fail to achieve the required MOD operational requirements.

TITLE.P: Provision for LF28 Ad Hoc Repairs and Procurement

INFO_ADD.P: The Authority reserves the right to amend any condition related to security of information to reflect any changes in national law or government policy. If any contract documents are accompanied by instructions on safeguarding classified information (e.g. a Security Aspects Letter), the Authority reserves the right to amend the terms of these instructions to reflect any changes in national law or government policy, whether in respect of the applicable protective marking scheme, specific protective markings given, the aspects to which any protective marking applies, or otherwise. The link below to the Gov.uk website provides information on the Government Security Classification.

Advertising Regime OJEU:- This contract opportunity is published in the Official Journal of the European Union (OJEU),the MoD Defence Contracts Bulletin and www.contracts.mod.uk GO Reference: GO-2018413-DCB-12223967.
